intro: Tournefortiopsis crispiflora subsp. discolor, commonly known as the hairy leaf tournefortiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The subspecies discolor is distinguished by its variegated leaves, which display a mix of green and white or silver hues. It typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the arid and sunny conditions of its native environment. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
